notes.text:
Don't overcook shrimp - they cook quickly
Use good quality white wine
Extra lemon juice brightens the dish

steps.descr: Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat

on_enter.say: Right, let's melt that lovely butter in a large pan over medium heat. You'll know it's ready when it starts to bubble gently.

steps.instructions: Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat

steps.descr: Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook 1 minute

on_enter.say: Now, let's add the garlic and a pinch of red pepper flakes. Give it a minute to cook and let those aromas fill your kitchen!

steps.instructions: Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook 1 minute

steps.descr: Add shrimp and cook until pink (2-3 minutes per side)

on_enter.say: Time to add the shrimp! Cook them until they're beautifully pink, about 2 to 3 minutes on each side. You'll hear a nice sizzle!

steps.instructions: Add shrimp and cook until pink (2-3 minutes per side)

steps.descr: Pour in wine and lemon juice

on_enter.say: Let's pour in the wine and a good squeeze of lemon juice. This will add a lovely zing to the dish!

steps.instructions: Pour in wine and lemon juice

on_enter.say: Now, let's let that simmer until the sauce reduces slightly. You'll see it thicken up a bit, which is perfect!
Time to stir in that fresh parsley. It adds a lovely freshness and a pop of color!

steps.descr: Serve over pasta or with bread for dipping

on_enter.say: And there we have it! Serve this beauty over some pasta or with crusty bread for dipping. Enjoy your delicious shrimp scampi!

steps.instructions: Serve over pasta or with bread for dipping

recipe.title: Shrimp Scampi
recipe.description: Garlic butter shrimp with white wine and fresh herbs
